Ok so finally got the gearbox back in my bus yesterday so thought id fit the new CSP shifter thats been sat in a box a good while
upon removing the old shifter i thought the ball on the end looked a bit big compared to the one on the CSP but i know i have ordered a CSP shifter for a 1960 bus so not to worry i thought.... upon fitting the shifter is shifted gear but hit the dash so i tried sliding the whole unit back this resulted in inability to shift gear and find neutral..... and well it all feels like the shifter is moving way before its engaging the shift rod .....

the 2 shifters side by side


old shifter 18mm flat base ball bit 20mm across


CSP shifter 12mm flat base ball bit 15mm across
does this mean i could have possibly the wrong front shift rod in my bus??? im thinking my bus maybe has the 1959-1962 one fitted when maybe it should be the 1955-1959 one

im a tad confused???
anybody shed any light on this??

Sean

the spring steel style hold down which from what ive been reading about over on thesamba alot instead of the nylon bush that you get supplied with as a replacement
but it looks like its the wrong shift rod due to the cup size

50-60
61-65
66-67
68-79
